quiz1.question: What does Article 1 of the Indian Constitution state?
quiz1.article: Article 1: Name and territory of the Union

options.text: India shall be known as Hindustan
India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States
India, that is Bharat, is a Union of Territories

quiz1.question: Which schedule specifies the States and Union territories in the Constitution?
quiz1.article: Article 1: The States and territories thereof

quiz1.question: What is included in the territory of India according to Article 1?

options.text: Only the territories of the States
The territories of the States, Union territories, and acquired territories

quiz1.question: Who has the authority to admit new States into the Union of India?
quiz1.article: Article 2: Admission or establishment of new States

quiz1.question: What was omitted by the Constitution (Thirty-sixth Amendment) Act, 1975?
quiz1.article: Article 2A: Sikkim's association with the Union

options.text: Association of Sikkim with the Union

quiz1.question: Which of the following can Parliament do under Article 3?
quiz1.article: Article 3: Formation and alteration of States

options.text: Form new States and alter areas or names of existing States

quiz1.question: What is required before introducing a Bill to alter the boundaries of any State?
What does Explanation I of Article 3 state about the term 'State'?

options.text: State includes only territories of States

quiz1.question: What is the role of laws made under Articles 2 and 3 according to Article 4?

options.text: They do not affect the First and Fourth Schedules
They are considered amendments to the Constitution
They provide for amendments of the First and Fourth Schedules
They cannot amend the First and Fourth Schedules

quiz1.question: Which amendment omitted the words “specified in Part A or Part B of the First Schedule”?
What is required before a Bill altering the name of a State is introduced in Parliament?

options.text: The Bill must be referred by the President to the Legislature of the State

quiz1.question: Which power does Parliament have under clause (a) of Article 3?
quiz1.article: Article 3: Parliament’s power to form new States

options.text: Form a new State by separating territory from an existing State
Change the constitution to alter State names

quiz1.question: What does Article 4 state about the effect of laws made under Articles 2 and 3?

options.text: They are not considered amendments of the Constitution
They need approval from the Prime Minister

quiz1.question: Which Article provides for the amendment of the First and Fourth Schedules?
What must a law under Article 3 contain regarding the affected States?

options.text: Provision for a change in representation in Parliament
A referendum to approve the changes

quiz2.question: Who is considered a citizen of India at the commencement of the Constitution under Article 5?
quiz2.article: Article 5: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution

options.text: Only those born in the territory of India
Every person domiciled in India who was born in the territory of India, or either of whose parents was born in India, or has been an ordinary resident for 5 years

quiz2.question: Which group of people is addressed in Article 6?
quiz2.article: Article 6: Rights of citizenship of persons who migrated from Pakistan

options.text: People who migrated to India from Pakistan

quiz2.question: Under Article 6, what condition must a person migrating to India before July 19, 1948, fulfill to be considered a citizen?
quiz2.article: Article 6: Rights of citizenship of persons who migrated from Pakistan

options.text: Must apply for citizenship after arrival
Must have been ordinarily resident in India since the date of migration
Must live in India for 6 months

quiz2.question: What is required for a person who migrated to India after July 19, 1948, to be registered as a citizen?
quiz2.article: Article 6: Rights of citizenship of persons who migrated from Pakistan

options.text: Must have been registered by an officer appointed by the Government of the Dominion of India
Must apply after living in India for 10 years

quiz2.question: According to Article 7, what happens to persons who migrated from India to Pakistan after March 1, 1947?
quiz2.article: Article 7: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan

options.text: They are not considered citizens of India
They can return and regain citizenship anytime

quiz2.question: Under what condition can a person who migrated to Pakistan return and be considered a citizen of India?
quiz2.article: Article 7: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan

options.text: If they return under a permit for resettlement or permanent return
If they lived in Pakistan for less than 5 years
If their grandparents were born in India
If they apply through the Indian Embassy

quiz2.question: Who can be considered a citizen of India under Article 8?
quiz2.article: Article 8: Rights of citizenship of persons of Indian origin residing outside India

options.text: Persons of Indian origin residing outside India, whose parents or grandparents were born in India
Only those born in India but living abroad

quiz2.question: How can persons of Indian origin residing outside India acquire Indian citizenship under Article 8?
quiz2.article: Article 8: Rights of citizenship of persons of Indian origin residing outside India

options.text: By being registered as citizens by the diplomatic or consular representative of India
By applying to the Indian Prime Minister
By residing in India for 6 months

quiz2.question: What happens to an Indian citizen who voluntarily acquires citizenship of a foreign state according to Article 9?
quiz2.article: Article 9: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State

options.text: They must reapply for Indian citizenship

quiz2.question: Can a person be a citizen of India by virtue of Articles 5, 6, or 8 if they acquire citizenship of another country?
quiz2.article: Article 9: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State

options.text: Yes, they can retain dual citizenship
No, they lose Indian citizenship upon acquiring foreign citizenship
They must apply for special permission to retain Indian citizenship
Only if they hold a special status

quiz2.question: What does Article 10 state about the continuance of citizenship?
quiz2.article: Article 10: Continuance of the rights of citizenship

options.text: Citizenship continues unless Parliament enacts laws that affect it

quiz2.question: Who has the ultimate authority to regulate citizenship in India according to Article 11?
quiz2.article: Article 11: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law

quiz2.question: What does Article 11 allow Parliament to regulate?
quiz2.article: Article 11: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law

options.text: The acquisition and termination of citizenship
Only the citizenship of those born in India

quiz2.question: What law defines India in the context of Article 6?
quiz2.article: Article 6: Rights of citizenship of persons who migrated from Pakistan

quiz2.question: Under what provision can Parliament make laws regarding the termination of citizenship?
quiz2.article: Article 11: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law

quiz3.question: What are the six fundamental rights guaranteed by the Constitution of India under Part III?
quiz3.article: General: Part III of the Constitution

options.text: Right to equality, right to freedom, right against exploitation, right to property, right to constitutional remedies, and right to religion
Right to equality, right to freedom, right against exploitation, right to freedom of religion, cultural and educational rights, and right to constitutional remedies
Right to freedom, right to property, right against exploitation, right to equality, and right to religion
Right to life, right to education, right to freedom, right to property, right to speech, and right to equality

quiz3.question: What does Article 14 of the Constitution guarantee?

options.text: Equality before the law and equal protection of the laws

quiz3.question: Which Article guarantees the right to freedom of speech and expression?
Which Article of the Constitution abolishes untouchability?
Which Article guarantees protection against discrimination on the grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth?
Under which Article are citizens guaranteed the right to life and personal liberty?
quiz3.article: Article 21: Protection of Life and Personal Liberty

quiz3.question: Which Article guarantees the right to constitutional remedies?
What does Article 23 prohibit?
quiz3.article: Article 23: Prohibition of Traffic in Human Beings and Forced Labour

options.text: Traffic in human beings, begar, and forced labour

quiz3.question: Which Article protects the cultural and educational rights of minorities?
quiz3.article: Article 29: Protection of Interests of Minorities

quiz3.question: Which Article guarantees the right to freedom of religion?
quiz3.article: Article 25: Freedom of Conscience and Free Profession, Practice, and Propagation of Religion

quiz3.question: Which Article provides the right against exploitation, specifically prohibiting child labor in hazardous conditions?
quiz3.article: Article 24: Prohibition of Employment of Children in Factories, etc.

quiz3.question: Which Article guarantees equality of opportunity in matters of public employment?
quiz3.article: Article 16: Equality of Opportunity in Matters of Public Employment

options.text: Titles except for military and academic distinctions

quiz3.question: Which Article guarantees the right to education for all children?
Which Article deals with the freedom to manage religious affairs?
quiz3.article: Article 26: Freedom to Manage Religious Affairs

quiz4.question: What is the main purpose of the Directive Principles of State Policy in the Indian Constitution?

options.text: To promote economic and social democracy
To ensure the right to property

quiz4.question: Which Article directs the state to secure a social order for the promotion of the welfare of the people?
quiz4.article: Article 38: State to Secure a Social Order

quiz4.question: Under which Article should the state strive to minimize inequalities in income and eliminate inequalities in status, facilities, and opportunities?
Which Article requires the state to ensure equal pay for equal work for both men and women?
quiz4.article: Article 39(d): Equal Pay for Equal Work

quiz4.question: Which Article directs the state to provide free legal aid to ensure that opportunities for securing justice are not denied to any citizen by reason of economic or other disabilities?
quiz4.article: Article 39A: Equal Justice and Free Legal Aid

quiz4.question: Which Article mandates that the state shall secure for the citizens a living wage and humane conditions of work?
Which Article directs the state to make provision for securing just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief?
quiz4.article: Article 42: Just and Humane Conditions of Work and Maternity Relief

quiz4.question: Which Article encourages the state to promote the participation of workers in the management of industries?
quiz4.article: Article 43A: Participation of Workers in Management

quiz4.question: Which Article of the Constitution promotes the state's duty to raise the level of nutrition and the standard of living?
quiz4.article: Article 47: Duty of the State to Raise the Level of Nutrition

quiz4.question: Which Article of the Constitution promotes early childhood care and education for children below the age of six years?
quiz4.article: Article 45: Provision for Early Childhood Care

quiz4.question: Which Article provides for the promotion of educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and other weaker sections?
quiz4.article: Article 46: Promotion of Educational and Economic Interests

quiz4.question: Which Article promotes the protection of monuments and places of historical and national importance?
Which Article separates the judiciary from the executive in the public services of the state?
quiz4.article: Article 50: Separation of Judiciary from Executive

quiz4.question: Which Article promotes international peace and security?
quiz4.article: Article 51: Promotion of International Peace and Security

quiz4.question: Which Article directs the state to organize village panchayats and endow them with powers for self-governance?

quiz5.question: Which Article of the Constitution mentions the office of the President of India?
For how many years does the President of India hold office?
Which Article describes the qualifications for the election of the President of India?
Which Article provides the procedure for the impeachment of the President of India?
Which Article of the Constitution deals with the Vice President of India?
Which Article gives the Vice President the power to act as President during the President's absence?
Under which Article is the Parliament empowered to make laws on the Union and Concurrent Lists?
Which Article specifies the powers of the Parliament to make laws for implementing treaties?
Which Article empowers the Parliament to increase or decrease the area or boundaries of any State?
Which Article of the Constitution deals with the executive power of the Union?
Which Article of the Constitution mandates the establishment of the Supreme Court of India?
Which Article provides for the appointment of the Chief Justice of India?
Which Article of the Constitution provides for the appointment of the Attorney-General for India?
Which Article of the Constitution deals with the powers of the Supreme Court regarding enforcement of Fundamental Rights?
Which Article gives the Union Executive the power to issue ordinances when Parliament is not in session?

quiz6.question: Which Article relates to the formation of new States?
Which Article specifies the powers of the Governor?
Which Article allows the President to impose President's Rule in a State?
Which Article provides for the establishment of the State Legislature?
Which Article deals with the composition of the Legislative Assembly?

quiz7.question: Which Article mentions the distribution of legislative powers between the Union and States?
Which Article deals with the Concurrent List?
Which Article specifies the procedure for amending the Constitution?
Which Article provides for the establishment of a Finance Commission?
Which Article provides for the distribution of taxes between the Union and States?
Which Article provides for the appointment of a Finance Commission?
Which Article mentions the powers of Parliament to make laws for the territories in India?

Which Article deals with the appointment of the Comptroller and Auditor General?
Which Article empowers the Union to legislate on matters in the State List during emergencies?
Which Article provides for the distribution of revenue between the Union and States?
Which Article specifies the procedure for the transfer of territory from one State to another?

quiz8.question: Which Article mentions the administration of Union territories?
Which Article provides for the governance of the Union territory of Delhi?
Which Article provides for the establishment of Legislative Assemblies for Union territories?

Which Article deals with the administration of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands?
Which Article deals with the administration of the Lakshadweep Islands?
Which Article provides for the establishment of the Union territory of Puducherry?
Which Article deals with the representation of Union territories in Parliament?
Which Article deals with the appointment of the Administrator for Union territories?
Which Article empowers the President to make regulations for Union territories?

quiz9.question: Which Article provides for the administration of Scheduled Areas?
Which Article deals with the powers of the Governor in Scheduled Areas?
Which Article provides for the administration of Scheduled Tribes?
Which Article empowers Parliament to make laws for Scheduled Areas?
Which Article provides for the administration of the Fifth Schedule?
Which Article provides for the establishment of a Tribes Advisory Council?
Which Article provides for the appointment of a Commissioner for Scheduled Castes?
Which Article provides for the appointment of a Commissioner for Scheduled Tribes?
Which Article provides for the establishment of a National Commission for Scheduled Castes?

quiz10.question: Which Article specifies the procedure for amending the Constitution?
Which Article deals with the power of the Parliament to amend the Constitution?
Which Article empowers the President to summon Parliament?
Which Article provides for the procedure to be followed in the case of a Bill passed by one House of Parliament?
Which Article provides for the assent of the President to Bills?

Which Article empowers the President to summon a joint session of Parliament?
Which Article provides for the procedure for the passage of a Money Bill?
Which Article provides for the introduction of Money Bills in the Lok Sabha?

Which Article empowers Parliament to legislate on matters in the State List under certain circumstances?
Which Article provides for the resolution of disputes related to water between states?
Which Article deals with the administrative relations between the Union and the States?
Which Article empowers the Union to give directions to the States?
